| What does this do? | Limits the maximum number of Entra joined/registered devices per user (recommended â‰¤20) and prevents the Global Administrator role from being added as a local administrator during Entra join. |
| Why should you use this? | Reduces attacker persistence via excessive device registrations and enforces least privilege on devices to lower compromise impact. |
| What is the end-user impact? | Users cannot register more devices after reaching the quota; admins must use Device Enrollment Manager for bulk enrollments and use designated local admin accounts instead of Global Admins (minor administrative overhead). |
